questions.question: I took him …………………… his brother. They are quite alike.
questions.description: To take for is to mistake for another person.

questions.question: They ……………………… with the best intentions.
questions.description: To set out is to start a journey.

questions.question: The new chairman will …………………………… on 20th January.
questions.description: To take over is to assume responsibility.

questions.question: When water was poured on his face, he soon came ………………………
questions.description: To come around is to regain consciousness.

questions.question: An orator must be good at getting his message …………………………….
questions.description: To get your message across is to convey it.

questions.question: He is getting ……………………… well in his career.
questions.description: To get on is to progress.

questions.question: He kept ………………………… asking silly questions.
questions.description: To keep on is to continue.

questions.question: The government failed to …………………………… the riots.
questions.description: To put down is to crush.

questions.question: They all look ……………………………… him as their leader.
questions.description: To look up to somebody is to treat them with respect.

questions.question: Once he became successful, he began to look …………………………… his old friends.
questions.description: To look down on somebody is to treat them with contempt.

questions.question: The doctor advised him to abstain …………………………… alcoholic drinks.
questions.description: To abstain from is to refrain him.

questions.question: He had promised to lend me some money, but he backed ………………………… later.
questions.description: To back out is to withdraw from a promise.
